Congress appropriated an additional $2.5 million for Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide appropriation for US Special Operations Command (USSOCOM) for a demonstration project for contractors employing persons with disabilities to manufacture mechanical tourniquets, but DoD determined such tourniquets must first undergo testing and evaluation of product effectiveness prior to acquisition. The realignment allows the Defense Health Agency, as the lead for the Departmentâ€™s medical research, to conduct a test and evaluation study of the product with Joint representation from the major Service Component Commands. This is a congressional special interest item. This is a base budget requirement.
